unalcol.optimization

Class OptimizationFunction<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • unalcol.algorithm.ThreadFunction<I,O>
      • unalcol.algorithm.Algorithm<T,java.lang.Double>
        • unalcol.optimization.OptimizationFunction<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Function<T,java.lang.Double>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ackley, BlackBoxFunction, Bohachevsky, BoundedlyDeceptive, Deceptive, GlovitoFitness, Griewangk, M7_Deceptive, M9_Deceptive, MaxOnes, QueenFitness, Rastrigin, RealFitness, RosenbrockSaddle, RoyalRoad, Schwefel

    public abstract class OptimizationFunction<T>
extends Algorithm<T,java.lang.Double>

    Title: OptimizationFunction

    Description: Abstract definition of an optimization function. An optimization function is a map f:T -> R where T is any set and R is the real numbers set.

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2010

    Company: Kunsamu

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jonatan Gomez

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isNonStationary()
      Determines if the fitness function is stationary or not, i.e., if the value of the function for a given value can change in time (non-stationary) or not (stationary)
      void update(int k)
      Updates the optimization function if it is non stationary

    • Method Detail

      • isNonStationary

        public boolean isNonStationary()
        Determines if the fitness function is stationary or not, i.e., if the value of the function for a given value can change in time (non-stationary) or not (stationary)
        Returns:
        true if the fitness function is not stationary, false if it is stationary

      • update

        public void update(int k)
        Updates the optimization function if it is non stationary
        Parameters:
        k - Current iteration of the optimizer
